CBRS.ProRated.Inattentive.Description: Sum score of responses from the CBRS DSM IV Inattentive scale (i.e., items 9, 10, 20, 29, 30, 41, 50, 71, and 79) divided by the number of completed items from that scale.

CBRS.Prorated.Hyperactive.Description: Sum score of responses from the CBRS DSM IV Hyperactive/Impulsive scale (i.e., items 3, 23, 39, 42, 49, 55, 59, 76 and 80) divided by the number of completed items from that scale.

WASI_FULL_2_IQ.Description: Score from abbreviated 2 scale IQ test from the Wechsler Abbreviated Scale of Intelligence (WASI). Citation: Wechsler, D. (2011). Wechsler Abbreviated Scale of Intelligence--Second Edition (WASI-II)

RACE.MULTIPLE.Description: The participant has multiple racial identities

PSYMED_ATYP_ANTIPSYCHOTIC_YN.Description: The participant takes aytipical antipsychotic medication

PSYMED_NONSTIM_ANTIADHD_YN.Description: The participant takes non-stimulant ADHD medication

MED_LOAD.Description: Psychotropic medication load. Calculated from participant's current medications using guidelines proposed in Sackeim HA. The definition and meaning of treatment-resistant depression. J Clin Psychiatry. 2001;62 Suppl 16:10-7. PMID: 11480879.

CGAS_CURRENT_SCORE.Description: Children's Global Assessment Scale (CGAS) score. Clinician-completed rating on a scale from 0 to 100. Citation: Schaffer D, Gould MS, Brasic J, et al. (1983) A children's global assessment scale (CGAS). Archives of General Psychiatry, 40, 1228-1231.

SCAR_H_IMPULSIVITY_MEAN.Description: Mean score from Impulsivity subscale of parent-reported Screen for Children’s Affective Reactivity–Home (SCAR-H). Citation: Kolko DJ, Baumann BL, Bukstein OG, Brown EJ. Internalizing symptoms and affective reactivity in relation to the severity of aggression in clinically referred, behavior-disordered children. J Child Fam Stud. 2007;16:745–759.

SCAR_H.23_TROUBLE_WAIT.Description: Item 23 from Impulsivity scale of the Screen for Children’s Affective Reactivity–Home (SCAR-H). Citation: Kolko DJ, Baumann BL, Bukstein OG, Brown EJ. Internalizing symptoms and affective reactivity in relation to the severity of aggression in clinically referred, behavior-disordered children. J Child Fam Stud. 2007;16:745–759.

Levels.3: A lot

SCAR_H.24_CONTROL_IMPULSE.Description: Item 24 from Impulsivity scale of the Screen for Children’s Affective Reactivity–Home (SCAR-H). Citation: Kolko DJ, Baumann BL, Bukstein OG, Brown EJ. ARI_P_TOTAL.Description: Total score on the parent-completed Affective Reactivity Index (ARI), with values ranging from 0 to 12. Citation: Stringaris A, Goodman R, Ferdinando S, Razdan V, Muhrer E, Leibenluft E, Brotman MA. The Affective Reactivity Index: a concise irritability scale for clinical and research settings. J Child Psychol Psychiatry. 2012 Nov;53(11):1109-17.

ARI_P1_ANNOYED.Description: Item 1 from the Affective Reactivity Index (ARI-P). Citation: Stringaris A., et al. The Affective Reactivity Index: a concise irritability scale for clinical and research settings. J Child Psychol Psychiatry. 2012 Nov;53(11):1109-17. PMID: 22574736.

DX.ANX.Description: The participant meets criteria for an anxiety disorder using the Kiddie Schedule for Affective Disorders - Present and Lifetime Version (KSADS-PL). Citation: Kaufman J, Birmaher B, Brent D, Rao U, Flynn C, Moreci P, Williamson D, Ryan N. Schedule for Affective Disorders and Schizophrenia for School-Age Children-Present and Lifetime Version (K-SADS-PL): initial reliability and validity data. J Am Acad Child Adolesc Psychiatry. 1997 Jul;36(7):980-8.

DX.ADHD.Description: The participant meets criteria for attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder using the ADHD supplement of the Kiddie Schedule for Affective Disorders - Present and Lifetime Version (KSADS-PL). Citation: Kaufman J, Birmaher B, Brent D, Rao U, Flynn C, Moreci P, Williamson D, Ryan N. Schedule for Affective Disorders and Schizophrenia for School-Age Children-Present and Lifetime Version (K-SADS-PL): initial reliability and validity data. J Am Acad Child Adolesc Psychiatry. 1997 Jul;36(7):980-8.

DX.DMDD.Description: The participant meets criteria for disruptive mood dysregulation disorder using the DMDD supplement of the Kiddie Schedule for Affective Disorders - Present and Lifetime Version (KSADS-PL). Citation: Kaufman J, Birmaher B, Brent D, Rao U, Flynn C, Moreci P, Williamson D, Ryan N. Schedule for Affective Disorders and Schizophrenia for School-Age Children-Present and Lifetime Version (K-SADS-PL): initial reliability and validity data. J Am Acad Child Adolesc Psychiatry. 1997 Jul;36(7):980-8.

DX.ODD.Description: The participant meets criteria for oppositional defiant disorder (ODD) using the Kiddie Schedule for Affective Disorders - Present and Lifetime Version (KSADS-PL). Citation: Kaufman J, Birmaher B, Brent D, Rao U, Flynn C, Moreci P, Williamson D, Ryan N. Schedule for Affective Disorders and Schizophrenia for School-Age Children-Present and Lifetime Version (K-SADS-PL): initial reliability and validity data. J Am Acad Child Adolesc Psychiatry. 1997 Jul;36(7):980-8.

DX.HV.Description: The participant is a healthy volunteer and does not meet criteria for any psychiatric disorder using the Kiddie Schedule for Affective Disorders - Present and Lifetime Version (KSADS-PL). Citation: Kaufman J, Birmaher B, Brent D, Rao U, Flynn C, Moreci P, Williamson D, Ryan N. Schedule for Affective Disorders and Schizophrenia for School-Age Children-Present and Lifetime Version (K-SADS-PL): initial reliability and validity data. J Am Acad Child Adolesc Psychiatry. 1997 Jul;36(7):980-8.

KSADS_INATTENTION.Description: Sum score of questions from the Kiddie Schedule for Affective Disorders - Present and Lifetime Version (KSADS-PL) ADHD screener and supplement assessing inattention: difficulty sustaining attention, easily distracted, makes a lot of careless mistakes, doesn't listen, difficulty following directions, difficulty organizing tasks, dislikes/avoids tasks requiring attention, loses things, forgetful in daily activities.

KSADS_SUSTAIN_ATTNTN.Description: Item from the ADHD screener of the Kiddie Schedule for Affective Disorders - Present and Lifetime Version (KSADS-PL). Citation: Kaufman J., et al. J Am Acad Child Adolesc Psychiatry. 1997 Jul;36(7):980-8. PMID: 9204677.

Levels.3: Threshold
